column4: does anyone else know of any DVD2DIVX/MPEG converters other than drip? drip does not work on region 1 (NTSC) dvds :(
hrrm.. thats odd.. you sure you dont just have a region0-specific dvdrom firmwaer?
Drip is not yet usable for NTSC (Region1) DVDs because those are prepared differently as PAL DVDs.
that is what it says on the website
aaah NTSC vs PAL
okay
i am wondering what else i can use (they should really at that to the text summary in synaptip i was about to installdrip)
there is this program called dvd::rip ... different to drip
is that in the repos?
errr looking
it is :-)
there you go then
there is also thoggen... may eb worth tryign when running dapper.. etc.
there is not a desktop file for dvd::rip :-\
''desktop file'' ???
it does not appear in the app menu
its in /usr/lib/menu/dvdrip
as perthe ubuntu package file listing.. bnut thats in dapper/i386
same in breezy thuogh
not suer which menus etc. etc. use the file sin /usr/lib/menu.. maybe thats the 'debian' menu list
